turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about Dutugamunu.
turn.1: What was the reign of King Dutugamunu?
turn.2: Dutugamunu  Dutugamunu (, , also spelled as "Dutthagamani", also known as Dutthagamani Abhaya "fearless Gamini"), was a Sinhalese king of Sri Lanka who reigned from 161 BC to 137 BC.
turn.4: He is renowned for defeating and overthrowing Ellalan, the usurping Tamil prince from the Chola Kingdom, who had invaded the Kingdom of Rajarata in 205 BC.
turn.5: What other accomplishments did he have during his reign?
turn.6: Dutugamunu also expanded and beautified the city of Anuradhapura and projected the power of his native Rajarata region across the island of Sri Lanka.
turn.7: Are there any other interesting aspects about this article?
turn.8: Due to his significance as one of the most potent symbols of Sinhalese historical power, Dutugamunu's story is swathed in myth and legend.
turn.9: Is there any verifiable factual information?
turn.10: However, many aspects of the accounts of his life have been verified by contemporary inscriptions, and the basic account of his life is generally accepted as accurate.
turn.11: What is the most important fact in this article?
turn.12: The Mahavamsa describes how as a youth he mocked his father Kavantissa, king of Ruhuna, for refusing to wage war against the powerful invading Elara, the Chola king of Anuradhapura, who usurped the throne by killing the native kings.
